title: Rework crate features
body:
This PR makes some small breaking changes and reworks our features.

- Since `serde` `1.0.104`, we can reliably implement the correct traits for `ser::Error` regardless of crate features, so it's safe for us to never require the `std` feature of `serde`.
- Since Rust `1.36.0`, we can use the `alloc` crate on stable, which supports allocations in more targets than `std`.

title: Prepare for 0.4.7 release
body:
Includes:

- #77

title: Add Stream impls for more crate types
body:
The `OwnedStream` and `RefMutStream` types are logically `Stream`s, and it would be surprising for a consumer to discover that they aren't, creating friction when attempting to accept anything through a `impl Stream` bound.

The `Stack` type can also implement the `Stream` trait, even though it's not an immediately useful implementation it's a nice smoke-test that usages of `Stream`s are actually valid.

title: Prepare for 0.4.6 release
body: [Changeset since the last release](https://github.com/sval-rs/sval/compare/v0.4.5...master)

title: Update proc-macro2, quote, syn to version 1
Ensure cloning a string in OwnedValue is cheap
body: Fixes #65

title: Prepare for 0.4.5 release
body: Also adds a note to the `stack` module about its use of `unsafe`.

title: Re-organize some docs
body: Closes #66

title: include LICENSE files in derive
body: Signed-off-by: Igor Gnatenko <i.gnatenko.brain@gmail.com>

title: Prepare for 0.4.3 release
body: Also fixes an issue in `sval_json` where we don't actually support 128bit integers properly.

title: Add some docs to stream
body: Just so there's something users can copy + paste to get started when implementing a new `Stream`.

title: Add Error::unsupported variant
body:
Closes #58 

Adds a `Error::unsupported` method that can be used to signal some structure is not supported by the current `Stream`.

The changes to the default implementations of `Stream` to return `Err(unsupported)` instead of `Ok(())` are technically a breaking _behavioural_ change (they won't break builds), but since the previous default implementation is entirely useless (so any implementation of `Stream` would override them anyways) I'll push it through.

title: Support serde integration in no-std environments
body:
This is a spike that makes the `serde` integration of `sval` no-std compatible, so you could reasonably erase a `serde::Serialize` as a `sval::Value` in environments where you couldn't use `erased-serde`. There are some drawbacks though:

- Implementations that require buffering aren't supported in no-std. That includes the enum types in `serde`'s data model if they're capturing using `sval::serde::to_value`. We could work around this one by adding limited support buffered types that only have a single key/value/element.
- The representation of the `serde::Serialize` you get back out is not necessarily the same as the `serde::Serialize` you put in.

That means you're probably better off preferring `erased-serde` if it's available, but this is an option that might be good enough.

I need to figure out how to test the no-std implementation without depending on `serde-test`, since we need the `serde` we pull in not to have default features.

title: Apply a few micro-optimizations to sval -> serde integration
body: Just a few small changes to the `sval::serde::to_serialize` module that make it run a little faster than `erased-serde` for the Twitter JSON benchmark.

title: Fix up a few performance regressions
body:
The layout of the `collect` module is rather performance sensitive, and I regressed things while trying to clean it up. This PR does two things:

- A few micro-optimizations to the `collect` module to get it back on-par with the `0.2.0` release
- Removes the debug-mode checked stack. This one isn't a performance optimization, because it doesn't exist in release mode anyways. But since we can create `OwnedStream`s and pull the inner stream back out freely the debug stack could easily become inconsistent with the actual state of what's been streamed. So it doesn't seem to be worth the _weird_ API that was needed to make it work.

title: prepare for 0.4.0 release
body:
Ok, it looks like some links were broken. I also don't like that `sval_json::Writer::end` returns a type called `IntoInner` instead of a type called `End`. Renaming it is a breaking change, so I'll just roll that in to a `0.4.0` release.

Will this be the last release today?

title: prepare for 0.3.1 release
body: Tidies up some docs so users who find their way to `sval_json` via crates.io don't see the `sval` readme.

title: Remove Stream::begin and Stream::end
body: Closes #46

title: Prepare for 0.2.0 release
body:
Includes:

- #43 
- #44

title: Reverse order of args so they're always stream first like serde
body:
This is a breaking change.

Always pass the stream argument before the value argument as in `serde_json`.

title: Refactor OwnedStream API
Add some convenient Result types like fmt::Result
body:
Introduces a few convenient `Result` type aliases like `fmt::Result` for implementing streams and values:

- `value::Result = Result<(), value::Error>`
- `stream::Result = Result<(), stream::Error>`

title: Make refs to DebugStack zero-sized in release
body:
Also shifts the responsibility for poisoning to `OwnedCollect` so that all implementations of Stream can benefit from it.

Making references to `DebugStack` zero-sized has a noticeable performance impact in our micro-benchmarks (~34% improvement) so it seems worth the wackiness.

title: Poison the debug writer on error
body:
Closes #37 

Just makes sure our debug `Stream` deals with retries by failing instead of potentially outputting garbage.

It's not easy to observe at the moment but I figure I'll polish this up while it's all still fresh.

title: Prepare for 0.1.4 release
body:
Includes:

- Support for treating a `sval::Value` like a `std::fmt::Debug` (#34)
- Fixes up building `sval_json` for no-std targets (#35)

title: Refactor CI
body:
- Add a proper no-std target to CI to make sure we can build for it
- Reorganise build scripts a bit

title: Support converting Value into Debug
body:
Closes #33 

So that we can seamlessly convert an arbitrary `sval::Value` into a `std::fmt::Debug`, and write it to a formatter using the same format as `DebugMap` and `DebugList`. The API is similar to the `serde` integration.

It's not very interesting to try go from `std::fmt::Debug` to `sval::Value`, since there's no structure to work with.

I opted to add this as a module in the crate like `serde` integration rather than as a separate crate like JSON support because even though `std::fmt` is a more a format and less a serialization contract it's a standard tool for outputting structure. I might make it an opt-in crate feature though.

title: Owned streams
body:
Closes #24 

Refactors the internals of `sval` that weren't given much thought originally.

- There's now a private `collect` module that contains the extensions to `Stream` to make it nicer for complex values with a structure that's known upfront.
- Introduces `OwnedStream<S>`, a type for safely capturing some `impl Stream` that you can hang on to and call methods on. This is useful for sitting behind `tokio_trace`'s `Visit` type, which streams its structure one field at a time.

There might be a slight performance regression that needs to be measured.

title: Fix up derive_from example
body: It was rather hastily written on mobile and isn't actually valid at all.

title: Add example of deriving Value based on Serialize
Prepare for 0.1.2 release
body:
Featuring:

- #25 
- #26

title: Deprecate OwnedValue::from_value in favour of OwnedValue::collect
body:
The `OwnedValue::from_value` function name didn't make it very obvious what's involved in converting some `impl Value` into an `OwnedValue`.

The new `OwnedValue::collect` name is similar to `Iterator::collect`, it suggests there's some work involved.

title: Avoid allocating for OwnedValues consisting of primitive values
body: Avoiding creating an `Arc<[Token]>` internally for `OwnedValue` if the given value is a simple primitive.

title: Clean up invalid example toml and add html_root_url attr
body: There were a few issues with the example TOML in the docs. Also didn't have a `html_root_url` attribute, which prevents the docs for other libraries from linking back to `sval` types.

title: Add support for derive_from = serde
body:
Closes #7 

Allows you to write:

```rust
#[derive(Serialize, Value)]
#[sval(derive_from = "serde")]
enum MyData {
    ...
}
```

So that you can derive `sval::Value` using all of `serde`'s fancy features, and for types that `sval` itself doesn't directly support.

This requires the `serde` feature of `sval` to be enabled.

title: Flesh out some docs
body: Add docs for a bunch of areas that were missing.

title: Build on nightly again
body: I'm pretty sure I messed up the YAML for the allowed failures anyway so `nightly` wasn't building at all...

title: Add a test suite for the `Stack` type
body: It's a pretty fundamental piece of code in `sval`, and believe it or not adding some tests uncovered bugs!

title: Suppot arbitrary stack size
body:
Closes #13 

Adds an alternative implementation of `Stack` that uses `smallvec::SmallVec` internally, instead of a fixed-size array. This requires the `std` feature so can't be used in `no_std` environments.

Dependents can opt in to bigger stacks using the `arbitrary-depth` Cargo feature. We'll probably make this default for `std` eventually.

title: Publish local docs
body: Just while `docs.rs` is unable to build the crate docs (they're using an older nightly).
